{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560503,"name":"Mike Stitt","username":"stittrm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stittrm/{size}/175198_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T14:01:06.643Z","cooked":"

In a python robot that is a:

class MyRobot(wpilib.TimedRobot):

Is it possible to:

void frc::Watchdog::SuppressTimeoutMessage ( bool suppress )

-Thanks!

-Mike

This seems to be a wrapper around “a” watchdogtimer. Not “the” watchdogtimer in “wpilib.TimedRobot”

Ah, I misunderstood. It looks like the watchdog is private in C++, so you can’t override/access it:

github.com

    5.

    7.

    8.

    10.

    11.

    12.

    13.

    14.

    15.

Eventually I would like to make the robot base classes pure python (Make robot classes pure python · Issue #89 · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub) but I haven’t taken the time to do the translation. It should be a relatively straightforward thing to do, I just don’t have time.

Might be something you could take on though if this is something you need?

Perhaps during the off season, I would need some help setting up a robotpy contributors development environment.

-Mike

@virtuald - Our season has come to an end. I can work on: Make robot classes pure python · Issue #89 · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub

Could you point me to:

  • the appropriate communication channels
  • what I need for a development environment(s)
  • the coding standards

-Mike

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-04-02T13:36:21.029Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496057,"topic_slug":"robotpy-is-it-possible-to-suppress-the-watchdog-timeout-message","display_username":"Mike Stitt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/mostrobotpy/issues/89","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Make robot classes pure python · Issue #89 · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":54037,"username":"stittrm","name":"Mike Stitt","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/stittrm/{size}/175198_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-is-it-possible-to-suppress-the-watchdog-timeout-message/496057/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3577957,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-02T15:42:06.983Z","cooked":"
stittrm:
  • the appropriate communication channels

If you have real time questions, there’s the robotpy gitter channel: https://app.gitter.im/#/room/#robotpy_robotpy-wpilib:gitter.im. Github discussions is also appropriate (robotpy/mostrobotpy · Discussions · GitHub).

stittrm:
  • what I need for a development environment(s)

I do everything on macOS/Linux, it’s a lot easier than Windows. However, if you have Windows, that’s also doable. I added some notes to the README: GitHub - robotpy/mostrobotpy: Official Repository of python implementation of WPILib components

However, for this particular task, you don’t actually need to do that. See the end of this post.

stittrm:
  • the coding standards

We use black for formatting. That’s it. Probably should add everything in this post to robotpy’s docs…

Previous guidance when we were doing pure python stuff:

The python implementation of WPILib/HAL is derived from the Java implementation of WPILib. In particular, we strive to keep the python implementation of WPILib as close to the spirit of the original WPILib java libraries as we can, only adding language-specific features where it makes sense.

See the 2019 documentation for more thoughts that are still applicable: Updating RobotPy source code to match WPILib — RobotPy 2017 documentation

It would be good to look at how robot startup occurs mostrobotpy/subprojects/robotpy-wpilib/wpilib/_impl/start.py at main · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub

The java robot base class is allwpilib/wpilibj/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/RobotBase.java at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub and the C++ base class is at allwpilib/wpilibc/src/main/native/include/frc/RobotBase.h at main · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub … but we do some of that logic in start.py.

To create pure python base classes, until you run into something that isn’t available to python code you probably don’t actually have to install robotpy in a development environment manner as mentioned above. Here’s a terrible way to make your own robot base class:

import wpilib

class Robot:
    pass

wpilib.RobotBase = Robot
del Robot

Then you can just have your robot inherit from wpilib.RobotBase or one of its descendants. Once you have some stuff working, then you can integrate it into the actual mostrobotpy repo.

The first thing you’ll run into is that RobotBase has a main function that something tries to call. It’s implemented here: mostrobotpy/subprojects/robotpy-wpilib/gen/RobotBase.yml at main · robotpy/mostrobotpy · GitHub

Is a M3 Mac good for building robotpy?
